p: The process for the manufacturing and infusion of CAR-T cells is relatively complex not only for the clinical aspects, but also from an organizational and regulatory point of view. The production and infusion of CAR-T cells require a specific organizational structure; the clinical unit task force includes physicians and nurses, and numbers of other clinical and healthcare personnel with long-term expertise in the care of patients with either hematological malignancies or solid tumors and in HSCT procedures. Therefore, it is important to have a detailed list of the personnel and multi-disciplinary expertise involved in this process and their role and relationship.
